abstract: Although the win headed off new competition that could have led to lower prices for consumers, consumers can expect more choices in devices and services.
snippet: Although the win headed off new competition that could have led to lower prices for consumers, consumers can expect more choices in devices and services.
lead_paragraph: The two largest cellphone service providers  Verizon Wireless and AT&T  won a greater swath of radio spectrum in the government auction that ended this week, heading off new competition that could have led to lower prices for consumers.

headline.main: Verizon and AT&T Win Big in Auction of Spectrum
headline.print_headline: Verizon and AT&T Win Big in Auction of Spectrum

abstract: Analysts say that Verizon got a much better deal in the government auction than AT&T. Verizon bought four times the capacity for less than twice the price that AT&T paid.
snippet: Analysts say that Verizon got a much better deal in the government auction than AT&T. Verizon bought four times the capacity for less than twice the price that AT&T paid.
lead_paragraph: Here’s the telecom geek quiz of the day: What’s a megahertz pop?

headline.main: Verizon Licks Its Cheap Megahertz Pops
